step.title: Access the Hibernate Console perspective
step.para: When performing Hibernate tasks, context sensitive menus will be available if the Hibernate Console perspective is the active perspective. Accessing the Hibernate Console perspective is described in .

step.title: Access the New Hibernate XML file dialog

listitem.para: In the package explorer, expand the src folder and the relevant package node to reveal the class for which a mapping file is to be created.
Right click on the class and select NewHibernate XML Mapping files.

formalpara.title: Result:
formalpara.para: The New Hibernate XML Mapping files dialog displays.

figure.title: The New Hibernate XML Mapping files dialog

textobject.para: The New Hibernate XML Mapping files dialog

note.title: Depth control
note.para: It is possible to specify the level to which object references are mapped relative to the selected class as by clicking the checkbox in .

step.title: Access the sub-dialog
step.para: Click the Next button to proceed. The selected class name and mapping file name are displayed.

step.title: Review the file
step.para: Click the Next button to view the file to be created.

formalpara.title: Result:
formalpara.para: The file is displayed for review.

figure.title: The New Hibernate XML Mapping files dialog - Review file

textobject.para: The New Hibernate XML Mapping files dialog - Mapping file name

note.title: Creating multiple mapping files
note.para: It is possible to select the project, src folder or an individual package to create multiple mapping files in a single action. In this instance, all Java classes will be identified and listed in the display of . Individual classes may then be selected and deselected by clicking the appropriate checkbox.

step.title: Create the mapping file
step.para: Click the Finish button to create the file.

formalpara.title: Result:
formalpara.para: The file is created and ready for editing.
